description.narrative: IR 4.1 CP Policy Laws reviewed/revised policy, Legislative Framework, strategies and programmes are developed, reviewed, approved and enacted in accordance with UNCRC and international standards.

sector.narrative: Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: Pakistan United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Programmes in Pakistan (Emergencies Disaster Risk Reduction)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Pakistan: Reach Every District (RED)/Reach Every Community (REC) Strategy Evaluation Pakistan (2014-18)
Pakistan 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Pakistan Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 4.1 CP Policy Laws reviewed/revised policy, Legislative Framework, strategies and programmes are developed, reviewed, approved and enacted in accordance with UNCRC and international standards.
Child Protectin in Emergency related guidelines and training packages are available for NDMA, PDMA and relevant line departments

baseline.value: 1 SOPs on Separated Children and 2 training packages (KP and Sindh)

title.narrative: Inclusion of CPiE in NDMA and PDMA disaster preparedness plans
Gap analysis and prioritization exercise is concluded for Mapping and assessment of Child Protection Systems
National Commission for Child's Rights is created and functions
Child Rights violation data collection process initiated, data base set up and monitoring and reporting modalities exist, supported and establised in each province
CPMIS design, methodology and toolkit developed, districts-based piloting is implemented in selected districts

Number of complaints from children and/or their caretakers concerning the malfunctioning of the public administration, public service providers and responses (redressal) through Federal and Provincial Ombudsman and Parliamentary Committee, are increased comparatively with the precedent year

baseline.value: None (Target Increase in the number of complaints by 20% in comparison with previous year)

title.narrative: 5th UN CRC periodical report prepared through consultative process and submitted by the Government to UNCRC

baseline.value: OP is not ratified. Concluding Observations not implemented
